# **Natural Gas Power Generation Journal**

Greenhouse gas emissions (GHG) has been one of the largest contribution along with technological changes to the increase of cogeneration,which repurposes heat recovered from gas-powered turbines.
Over the last 20 years, the use of coal in electricity generation has fallen significantly, from 15% of total generation in 1996, to 11% by 2015. The use of natural gas in electricity generation has increased significantly, from 3% of total generation in 1996, to 11% by 2015
## Frequency of update 

1. Data had been collected from different public source directory

2. Use of R and RMarkdown has been used for Blog/journal preparation.

3. Most of the data are updated yearly .

4. Accuracy of data has been taken care.

5. Graphs and analysis are for knowledge and curosity.
